original: Close the window.
translated: Ferme la fenêtre !

original: You should bone up on your French before your trip to Marseille.

original: It's the thought that counts.

original: Tom sipped wine.

original: Were you able to solve the problem?

original: This box is light.

original: How long is it?

original: We have a decision to make.

original: Dog food is expensive.

original: I can't call her.

original: The Arctic is the area round the North Pole.

original: But of course!

original: Your lips are blue. You should get out of the water.
translated: Tes lèvres sont bleues, tu devrais sortir de l'eau.

original: I went to wash my hands.
translated: Je suis venu me laver les mains.

original: Let's improvise.

original: I'm broke and tired.

original: I never stop thinking about you.

original: She turned off the lights so she could enjoy the moonlight.
translated: Elle éteignit les lumières pour admirer le clair de lune.

original: Don't look there.

original: The past is no longer and the future is not yet.
translated: Le passé n'est plus et le future n'est pas encore.

original: Tom is grilling meat.
translated: Tom grille de la viande.

original: Better a broken promise than none at all.
translated: Mieux vaut une promesse rompue que pas de promesse du tout.

original: She ordered the book from England.
translated: Elle a commandé le livre en Angleterre.

original: How much is one beer?
translated: C'est combien, une bière ?

original: Turn it off.

original: Try another door.

original: I still make a lot of mistakes.

original: The problem is solved.

original: You can't teach a crab how to walk straight.

original: We're bordering on failure.

original: I would like you to sing a song.
translated: Je voudrais que vous chantiez une chanson.

original: It's not as easy to do that as people think.
translated: Ce n'est pas aussi facile qu'on le croit.

original: They don't understand English at all.
translated: Ils ne comprennent pas du tout l'anglais.

original: I'm getting rid of all this junk.
translated: Je me débarrasse de tout ce bazar.

original: I don't think that I need your help today.
translated: Je ne pense pas avoir besoin de ton aide aujourd'hui.

original: We're getting married in three months.

original: Who gave it to you?

original: Ann is said to be their leader.
translated: On dit qu'Anne est leur chef.

original: Tom isn't the same age as Mary.
translated: Tom n'a pas le même âge que Marie.

original: We'll miss Tom.

original: The map says we're no more than two kilometers from the treasure.
translated: Le plan indique que nous ne sommes plus qu'à deux kilomètres du trésor.

original: I'm more than just a pretty face.
translated: Je suis davantage qu'un joli visage.

original: I know every inch of New York.

original: Hey, don't forget this.

original: Are you afraid of dogs?

original: How do I look?

original: Are they not Englishmen?
translated: Ne sont-ils pas Anglais ?

original: Do you know any good places to eat around here?
translated: Connais-tu de bons endroits pour manger, autour d'ici ?

original: This is my city now.
translated: C'est ma ville désormais.

original: Call me if you want to do something together tomorrow.
translated: Appelle-moi si tu veux que nous fassions quelque chose ensemble, demain.

original: I'll text you the address.
translated: Je vous enverrai l'adresse par SMS.

original: It's such a long time since he left school.
translated: Il y a si longtemps qu'il a quitté l'école.

original: I'd like to talk to you for a minute.

original: She doesn't have her medication.

original: Were you aware of this?

original: Snow has begun to melt.

original: The shy boy murmured his name.
translated: Le garçon timide murmura son nom.

original: When he doesn't get what he wants, he pouts.
translated: Quand il n'obtient pas ce qu'il veut, il boude.

original: A home is more than a mere building.
translated: Une maison est plus qu'un simple bâtiment.

original: The situation worsened.

original: It kept me from reading.
translated: Ça m'a empêché de lire.

original: Have you been to Boston?
translated: As-tu été à Boston ?

original: We're out of butter.
translated: On n'a plus de beurre.

original: Writing is a deeper sleep than death.
translated: Écrire est un sommeil plus profond que la mort.

original: Is it possible that a 22 year old girl never had erotic dreams?
translated: Est-ce possible qu'une fille de 22 ans n'ait jamais fait de rêves érotiques ?

original: You absolutely have to go see this film. It's wonderful.
translated: Vous devez absolument aller voir ce film. Il est magnifique.

original: It's Friday.
translated: Nous sommes vendredi.

original: Do you have a soup dish?
translated: Avez-vous une soupière ?

original: I want to give you the chance to do that.
translated: Je veux te procurer l'occasion de faire ça.

original: Let's see if we can come up with a better solution.
translated: Voyons si nous pouvons trouver une meilleure solution.

original: Put the margarine in a bowl and mix until creamy.
translated: Mettre la margarine dans un bol et la rendre crémeuse.

original: Playing go is my favorite pastime.
translated: Mon passe-temps favori est le jeu de go.

original: We couldn't reach the initial goal.
translated: Nous n'avons pas pu atteindre l'objectif initial.

original: I'm going to eat.

original: And your parents? When are they arriving?
translated: Et tes parents ? Ils arrivent quand ?

original: I hate to waste my time.
translated: J'ai horreur de gaspiller mon temps.

original: Next thing you know, you'll be in the papers.
translated: Avant même que tu ne le saches, tu seras dans les journaux.

original: Maybe Tom will agree to do that.
translated: Peut-être que Tom acceptera de faire ça.

original: Tell me about it!

original: It looks like rain.
translated: Il semble pleuvoir.

original: I'm ready for the fight.
translated: Je suis prêt pour le combat.

original: I don't believe I'm listening to this.
translated: Je ne parviens pas à croire que j'écoute ça.

original: You're too young to understand such things.
translated: Tu es trop jeune pour comprendre ces choses-là.

original: There were many people at Giverny to see Monet's house and gardens.
translated: Il y avait beaucoup de gens à Giverny pour voir la maison et les jardins de Monet.

original: I'm not old enough to do that.
translated: Je ne suis pas assez vieux pour faire ça.

original: The human tendency to regard little things as important has produced very many great things.
translated: L'inclination humaine à considérer les petites choses comme importantes a produit de très nombreuses grandes choses.

original: We're expecting a lot of people to attend the ceremony.
translated: Nous nous attendons à ce que beaucoup de monde participe à la réunion.

original: You must go at once.
translated: Vous devez y aller immédiatement.

original: I hate it.

original: They were playing baseball in the park.
translated: Ils jouaient au baseball dans le parc.

original: Have you ever been in a traffic accident?
translated: As-tu déjà été pris dans un accident de la route ?

original: Where did I put that box?
translated: Où ai-je mis cette caisse ?

original: Please show me another one.
translated: Montre-m'en un autre s'il te plaît.

original: Everyone gossips.
translated: Tout le monde jase.

original: Due to the large amounts of snow over the last few days, school has been cancelled.
translated: À cause des importantes chutes de neige de ces derniers jours, l'école a annulé les cours.

original: The boy almost drowned.
translated: Le garçon se noya presque.

original: I don't lose my appetite when I get stressed, rather I can't calm down unless I eat something.
translated: Je ne perds pas l’appétit lorsque je suis angoissée. Au contraire, je ne parviens à me calmer qu’en mangeant quelque chose.

original: Tom doesn't swim very well.
translated: Tom ne nage pas très bien.

original: She always loves to learn new things.
translated: Elle adore toujours apprendre de nouvelles choses.

original: There are downsides to being pretty.
translated: Il y a des désavantages à être jolie.

original: He ran toward me as fast as he could.

original: Please help!

original: Don't worry about what needs to be done and get some rest.

original: We'll make camp near the lake.
translated: On va faire du bivouac près du lac.

original: Chinese food was served in small portions which did not require cutting with a knife or fork.
translated: La nourriture chinoise fut servie en petites portions qui ne nécessitaient pas d'être coupées avec un couteau ou une fourchette.

original: Sing us a song, please.
translated: Chante-nous une chanson, s'il te plaît.

original: Do you want to go to the station with me?
translated: Veux-tu venir, avec moi, jusqu'à la gare ?

original: It's a very decorative plant.
translated: C'est une plante très décorative.

original: Tom is a fascinating guy.
translated: Tom est un mec fascinant.

original: Between you and me, I think our boss is stupid.
translated: De toi à moi, je pense que notre patron est stupide.

original: Look what I found at the supermarket today.
translated: Regardez ce que j'ai déniché au supermarché aujourd'hui.

original: I should've studied Russian before.

original: You didn't have to finish early.
translated: Vous ne deviez pas finir tôt.

original: In order to travel, it is important to be able to speak multiple languages.
translated: Pour voyager, il est important de savoir parler plusieurs langues.

original: I rest my case.

original: Sometimes critics don't know what they criticise.
translated: Parfois les critiques ne savent pas ce qu'ils critiquent.

original: No risk, no reward.

original: Have you been smoking?
translated: Avez-vous fumé ?

original: The Marathi alphabet consists of 11 vowels and 36 consonants.
translated: L'alphabet marathi est composé de 11 voyelles et de 36 consonnes.

original: We shouldn't stay here.

original: They don't eat meat.

original: I was hoping you'd say that.

original: Have I hit the nail on the head?

original: On sunny winter mornings, the white frost twinkles on the lawn.
translated: Les matins d'hiver ensoleillés, la gelée blanche scintille sur la pelouse.

original: Were you happy?

original: Why doesn't she visit me anymore?

original: It's bucketing down.

original: You're very timid.

original: The rioters beat many policemen to death.
translated: Les émeutiers frappèrent de nombreux policiers à mort.

original: I feel morally indebted to her.
translated: Je me sens moralement endetté envers elle.

original: Don't get us confused.

original: What's the point of your question?

original: He was fooled.

original: You've just made the worst mistake of your life.

original: I don't mind the cold, but I can't stand the heat.
translated: Je ne crains pas le froid, mais je ne tolère pas la chaleur.

original: I liked your friends.

original: It's a good sign.

original: I don't like those people.

original: I was absolutely stunned.

original: You don't know how bad I want to leave.

original: I hear some screaming.

original: He is drinking tea.
translated: Il est en train de boire du thé.

original: Alice is sleeping in my room.
translated: Alice dort dans ma chambre.

original: They seem happy.
translated: Ils ont l'air heureux.

original: Where did you put the TV guide?
translated: Où as-tu mis le programme de télévision ?

original: Stop interfering.

original: It was Jack that broke the window yesterday.

original: We can't do this without some help.

original: He's tickled pink.

original: Today is my sister's birthday.
translated: Aujourd'hui, c'est l'anniversaire de ma sœur.

original: We hear with our ears.

original: It's his first day at school.

original: Yesterday I listened to a very beautiful song.

original: Don't tell anybody.

original: We weren't invited to the party.

original: Cook the peeled and chopped potatoes for 20 minutes in boiling water.
translated: Faites cuire les pommes de terre pelées et coupées en morceaux 20 minutes à l’eau bouillante.

original: Tom is childish.
translated: Tom est immature.

original: I prefer fish to meat.
translated: Je préfère le poisson à la viande.

original: Would you say it once more?

original: Mary despises Tom.

original: I will see you around.

original: I think you'll regret it if you don't go with us.

original: This hut is a very special place.

original: My office faces Fifth Avenue.

original: Love is like measles - everyone should experience it.
translated: L'amour, c'est comme la rubéole - tout le monde doit en faire l'expérience.

original: It's just blood.

original: A page of history is worth a volume of logic.

original: This seems fair.

original: I've tried to be your friend.

original: Why are they always fighting?

translated: J'ai attrapé la balle avec une main.

original: When he had said these things, he struck with reversed spear the side of the hollow mountain, and the winds, as a single column, race through the offered gate and blast the lands with a tornado.
translated: Il dit ; et, du revers de son sceptre divin, / du mont frappe les flancs : ils s'ouvrent, et soudain / en tourbillons bruyants l'essaim fougueux s'élance, / trouble l'air, sur les eaux fond avec violence.

original: That was a nifty way of doing it.
translated: C'était une façon astucieuse de le faire.

original: I chose these shoes.

original: Is Tom your name?

original: She promised me to clean my room.
translated: Elle m'a promis de nettoyer ma chambre.

original: The building is rotten inside and out.
translated: Le bâtiment est pourri, à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur.

original: That's not what I meant to say.

original: I don't know if I want to do that.

original: Dolphins use echolocation.

original: She doesn't know when the cafe will reopen.

original: Tom vomited blood.
translated: Tom a vomi du sang.

original: Teaching English is his profession.
translated: Enseigner l'anglais est sa profession.

original: The whole building has been put at our disposal.
translated: L'ensemble du bâtiment a été mis à notre disposition.

original: I'm glad you decided to come.
translated: Je me réjouis que vous vous soyez décidés à venir.

original: Hi, my name is Tom. What's your name?
translated: Salut, je suis Tom. Quel est ton nom?

original: Do you want me to help you with the cooking?
translated: Voulez-vous que je vous aide pour la cuisine ?

original: He is one of Spain's most famous authors.
translated: Il est l'un des écrivains les plus connus d'Espagne.

original: How many inhabitants are there?

original: You do not speak English.
translated: Vous ne parlez pas anglais.

original: I didn't even think that was possible.

original: Potentially, that could happen again.

original: They didn't hear the children.

original: Why do you say nothing when I ask you a question?
translated: Pourquoi tu ne dis rien quand je te pose une question ?

original: I went to a haunted house.
translated: J'ai visité une maison hantée.

original: Please forward this to as many people as possible.
translated: Je vous prie de rediriger ceci à autant de gens que possible.

original: The moon, an old woman with no ears.
translated: La lune, une vieille dame qui n’a pas d’oreilles.

original: That's the problem we have to solve.
translated: C'est le problème que nous devons résoudre.

original: Tom's tax rate is 15%, but his secretary's tax rate is 35%.
translated: Le taux d'imposition de Tom est de 15%, mais le taux d'imposition de sa secrétaire est de 35%.

original: He uncorked the bottle.
translated: Il débouchonna la bouteille.

original: May I borrow your pencil?
translated: Puis-je emprunter votre crayon ?

original: Stay away from my daughter.
translated: Tiens-toi à l'écart de ma fille !

original: Few people can speak a foreign language perfectly.
translated: Peu de gens parlent parfaitement une langue étrangère.

original: The ship dropped anchor in the harbor.
translated: Le navire a jeté l'ancre dans le port.

original: My wife likes to eat out and so she doesn't have to cook.
translated: Ma femme aime manger à l'extérieur, comme cela, elle n'a pas à cuisiner.

original: Well, I must be going.
translated: Bien, il faut que j'y aille.

original: I thought you'd be pleased.
translated: Je pensais que vous seriez satisfaits.

original: I hope you agree.
translated: J'espère que tu es d'accord.

original: Could I get some tea?
translated: Pourrais-je avoir du thé ?

original: The train should be here on time.
translated: Le train devrait être là à l'heure.

original: Both Tom and Mary look sad.
translated: Tom et Mary ont tous deux l'air triste.

original: How can I deactivate my account on this site?
translated: Comment puis-je désactiver mon compte sur ce site ?

original: Individual liberty is the essence of democracy.
translated: La liberté individuelle est l'essence de la démocratie.

original: I like almonds.
translated: J'aime les amandes.

original: She sold her Volkswagen and bought a Mercedes.
translated: Elle a vendu sa Volkswagen et a acheté une Mercedes.

original: I'm looking for a present for my mother. Do you have anything in mind?
translated: Je cherche un cadeau pour ma mère. Avez-vous quelque chose à l'esprit ?

original: Give me a jingle when you have a chance.

translated: J'étais l'homme le plus heureux de la terre.

original: There are no food shortages in Algeria.
translated: Il n'y a pas de pénurie alimentaire en Algérie.

original: At first, Meg was homesick.

original: How silly of me! I keep forgetting that.

original: Tom owns a lot of cars.
translated: Tom possède plein de voitures.

original: We got up at dawn.

original: I'm no longer a rookie.
translated: Je ne suis plus un débutant.

original: Tom makes his own original Christmas cards every year.
translated: Chaque année, Tom confectionne ses propres cartes de Noël originales.

original: Will you take that?

original: For the elderly, wounds take more time to heal.
translated: Chez les personnes âgées, les blessures mettent plus de temps à guérir.

original: Have you eaten something today?
translated: As-tu mangé quelque chose aujourd'hui ?

original: You'll get into trouble if your parents find out.
translated: Vous allez avoir des ennuis si vos parents le découvrent.

original: How many pipes does this organ have?

original: Sami stole Layla's boat.
translated: Sami a volé le bateau de Layla.

original: Are you speaking to me?
translated: Me parlez-vous ?

original: Someone's outside.
translated: Il y a quelqu'un dehors.

original: It's not raining yet.
translated: Il ne pleut pas encore.

original: I have sisters. I have no brothers.
translated: J'ai des sœurs. Je n'ai pas de frère.

original: Milk is a good beverage.
translated: Le lait est un bon aliment.

original: I won't be wearing a tie.

original: That's one interpretation.

original: He presented me to his brother.

original: Shall I prepare you a warm meal?

original: Tom made breakfast.

original: You're finicky.

original: You aren't as short as I am.
translated: Vous n'êtes pas aussi petit que moi.

original: You're just jealous, that's all.

original: He has two cars in his garage.
translated: Il a deux voitures dans son garage.

original: This fact proves her innocence.

original: Speak Italian!

original: I have faith in your ability to do the right thing.
translated: Je crois en ta capacité à faire ce qu'il faut.

original: Both were eager to become acquainted.

original: This machine is worthless.

original: I figured I'd find you here.

original: Systems in which the rules are based on usage, such as languages or customary law, are condemned to become absurd, cumbersome and contradictory, since every time a small error slips into one of their usages, it is integrated into the rules, by definition, for eternity. The more users are ignorant, the more systems degrade rapidly. English, poorly used by millions of people, natives or not, for centuries, is an example of the degradation of a system at terminal stage, no longer presenting any logic, neither in its syntax, nor its grammar, nor its vocabulary or its pronunciation. Similarly, with customary rights becoming too cumbersome and incomprehensible, the states which rely on them tend to switch to prescriptive law.
translated: Les systèmes dont les règles sont basées sur l'usage, tels que les langues ou les droits coutumiers, sont condamnés à devenir absurdes, pesants et contradictoires, puisque chaque fois que la moindre erreur se glisse dans un de leurs usages, elle s'intègre aux règles, par définition, pour l'éternité. Plus les utilisateurs sont des béotiens, plus les systèmes se dégradent rapidement. L'anglais, mal utilisé par des millions de gens, natifs ou pas, depuis des siècles, est un exemple de dégradation du système au stade terminal, ne présentant plus aucune logique, ni dans la syntaxe, ni dans la grammaire, ni dans le vocabulaire ou la prononciation. De même, le droit coutumier devenant trop lourd et incompréhensible, les états qui s'appuyaient dessus tendent à passer à un droit prescrit.

translated: Après tout nous allons avoir besoin de ton aide.

original: Tom isn't good at keeping secrets.

original: You can tell from the jargon alone that these instructions were written for experienced builders and not the average consumer.
translated: On peut dire, rien que d'après le jargon, que ces instructions ont été rédigées pour des bâtisseurs professionnels et non pour le consommateur lambda.

original: We got stuck in a traffic jam, which made us twenty minutes late.
translated: Nous sommes restés coincés dans une file, ce qui nous a causé vingt minutes de retard.

original: Do you subscribe to any magazines?
translated: Es-tu abonnée à de quelconques magazines ?

original: He was born in Ohio.

original: Alexandra used to write to her penfriend in Italy.
translated: Alexandra écrivit à son correspondant en Italie.

original: I must apologize for not having written for such a long time.

original: He hired some new workers.
translated: Il embaucha de nouveaux ouvriers.

original: I've rung the bell already.

original: Write Tom.

original: That was what I was going to say.

original: The farmer is scattering seeds over the field.

original: Yanni smiled.
translated: Yanni a souri.

original: That didn't work.

original: Aoi is a good dancer.
translated: Aoi est une bonne danseuse.

original: Do you know why Tom doesn't like me?

original: I'm going to miss you, too.

original: You shouldn't have gone there.

original: Do you have the vaccine?

original: I like what I see.
translated: J'aime ce que je vois.

original: Tom helped Mary to escape from prison.
translated: Tom a aidé Marie à s'évader de prison.

original: She'd like to become a teacher.
translated: Elle aimerait devenir institutrice.

original: Tom is a lot busier than I am.
translated: Tom est beaucoup plus occupé que moi.

original: I feel the same way about it as you do.
translated: Je ressens la même chose que toi à ce propos.

original: Beauty fades.

original: Everybody in the park looked up at the hot air balloon.
translated: Tout le monde dans le parc leva les yeux vers la montgolfière.

original: Keep Tom inside.
translated: Maintiens Tom à l'intérieur.

original: I wanted to tell you that.

original: Now we come to the first agenda item.
translated: Nous arrivons maintenant au premier point de l'ordre du jour.

original: I'd like to get started.
translated: J'aimerais commencer.

original: The white boat went down the stream.
translated: Le bateau blanc a descendu le ruisseau.

original: What do you call the last day of the year?

original: This is silly.

original: Someone has stolen all my money.

original: No one else could do my work.

original: Tom hoped that the doctors would tell him that he didn't need the surgery after all.
translated: Tom espérait que les médecins lui diraient qu'il n'aurait finalement pas besoin de se faire opérer.

original: You're not dead.

original: She tried to persuade him not to decline the offer.

original: The ship dropped anchor.

original: Tom calls Mary every night.

original: His words offended me.

original: Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage.

original: I don't have time to cook.

original: Had he heard the news, he might have been shocked.

original: I am looking for my cat.

original: These things aren't mine!

original: He ditched the car in an alley and took off running.

original: Tom thinks he's the only person in town who can play the bagpipes.

original: I'll leave this to your imagination.

original: The switch is off.

original: Does Tom know what happened?

original: Who're you talking to, clown?

original: As I opened the door, there stood an unknown man.
translated: Comme j'ouvrais la porte, se tenait là un homme inconnu.

original: Tom certainly wasn't at home when we went to visit him.
translated: Tom n'était certainement pas chez lui lorsque nous sommes allés lui rendre visite.

original: Tom has never kissed anyone in public.

original: Forget what I said.

original: She is growing tall.

original: Why did she become angry?

original: Chemistry isn't the only thing that stinks.

original: I like the way she smiles.

original: Kids like drawing.

original: How much am I paying you?

original: Tom thinks that's not a good idea.

original: I have no more ideas.

original: Pressed by the enemy, the soldiers were unable to throw their spears.
translated: Pressés par l'ennemi, les soldats n'ont pas pu jeter leurs lances.

original: I'm bleeding.

original: "Are you sure you want me to tell you?" "Please, I'm all ears!"

original: Everybody will be home for Christmas.
translated: Tout le monde sera à la maison pour Noël.

original: They're escaping.

original: Mr Green, you are wanted on the phone.
translated: M. Green, on vous demande au téléphone.

original: How about we go for a drink?

original: That's a fir tree.
translated: C'est un sapin.

original: What will we do if he's late?
translated: Qu'est-ce qu'on fera s'il est en retard ?

original: Can I at least get a hug?

original: Even a child would see the difference.
translated: Même un enfant verrait la différence.

original: These technical terms derive from Greek.
translated: Ces termes techniques proviennent du grec.

original: Don't think about the price.
translated: Ne pense pas au prix.

original: Thank you very much for inviting me.
translated: Merci beaucoup de m'inviter.

original: Thank you for the gift.
translated: Merci pour le cadeau.

original: They grow flowers in the garden.
translated: Ils cultivent des fleurs dans le jardin.

original: I heard a thud.

original: Walking under a ladder is bad luck.

original: Let's leave the decision to our teacher.

original: Careful with that rock.
translated: Soyez prudent avec cette pierre.

original: I believe I can trust you.
translated: Je pense que je peux vous faire confiance.

original: There are a lot of fish in this lake.
translated: Il y a beaucoup de poissons dans ce lac.

original: He was accused falsely.
translated: Il a été accusé à tort.

original: The watch doesn't work.
translated: L'horloge ne marche pas.

original: I wish you could be a little quieter.
translated: Si seulement tu pouvais être un peu plus tranquille !

original: He aspired to the position of Prime Minister.
translated: Il aspirait au poste de Premier Ministre.

original: I don't have time to make you a sandwich.
translated: Je n'ai pas le temps de te faire un sandwich.

original: China and Japan differ in many points.
translated: La Chine et le Japon sont différents sur bien des points.

original: Keep your coat on.
translated: Garde ton manteau sur toi.

original: "ẽ" is a letter in the Guarani alphabet.
translated: « ẽ » est une lettre de l'alphabet Guarani.

original: He decided not to go.
translated: Il a décidé de ne pas s'y rendre.

original: I want to have fun.
translated: Je veux m'amuser.

original: Everybody wants to rid himself of troubles.
translated: Chacun veut s'éviter des ennuis.

original: Roll up your sleeve.

original: You're careless.

original: I need to test you for tuberculosis.

original: I can't say anything now.

original: We need an ambulance.

original: I had some problems.

original: We cannot complete this work in a day.

original: The student is in the classroom.
translated: L'étudiante est dans la classe.

original: I'm going to work.

original: Enjoy yourself at the ball.
translated: Amusez-vous au bal.

original: War is not a natural disaster like an earthquake or a tsunami. It does not come without warning.
translated: La guerre n'est pas un désastre comme un tremblement de terre ou un tsunami. Elle ne vient pas sans avertissement.

original: She didn't seem interested.
translated: Elle ne semblait pas intéressée.

original: I liked walking alone on the deserted beach.
translated: J'ai apprécié de marcher seul sur la plage déserte.

original: What did you want to show me?

original: Let's try it once more.
translated: Essayons encore une fois.

original: The Johnsons love to have parties.
translated: La famille Johnson adore faire la fête.

original: No one's judging you.

original: I know she doesn't love her.
translated: Je sais qu'elle ne l'aime pas.

original: Tom was sitting at his desk.
translated: Tom était assis à son bureau.

original: Are you proud of your father?

original: I don't like the way he speaks to me.
translated: Je n'aime pas la façon dont il me parle.

original: Everyone survived.
translated: Tout le monde a survécu.

original: My sister is very fond of children.

original: How could I have fallen in love with him so quickly?

original: Oh my God, what'll we do?

original: What's become of the original plan?

original: It won't do any good to complain.

original: This is appalling.

original: Our revenge will be the laughter of our children.

original: The quantity of stars in the sky is infinite.
translated: La quantité d'étoiles dans le ciel est infinie.

original: The stock market crash of October 1987 in New York is still vividly remembered.
translated: Le crash du marché boursier de New-York d'octobre 1987 est toujours bien vivant dans les mémoires.

original: Cristiano Ronaldo is one of the world's best soccer players.
translated: Cristiano Ronaldo est l'un des meilleurs joueurs de football du monde.

original: We're having breakfast.
translated: Nous petit-déjeunons.

original: I may be overthinking this.

original: He's crazy about me.

original: He invested his capital in the steel trade.
translated: Il a investi son capital dans le commerce de l'acier.

original: We all like cycling.

original: Long time, no see.

original: I'll visit him tomorrow.

original: That really isn't funny.

original: He can not have done that.

original: I'm not sure if he saw it.
translated: Je ne suis pas sûr qu'il l'ait vu.

original: What do you think about it? It'd be great!

original: Our teacher began singing a song well.
translated: Notre professeur a commencé à bien chanter une chanson.

original: I don't know how to handle this.
translated: Je ne sais pas comment traiter ceci.

original: Were you at the cinema last night?

original: She is far from a fool.

original: I will follow the law.

original: Tom stands by me whenever I am in trouble.
translated: Tom me soutient toujours quand j'ai des problèmes.

original: Can you visualise how the garden will look once the flowers are in bloom?
translated: Arrives-tu à te représenter à quoi ressemblera le jardin une fois que les fleurs auront éclos ?

original: They grow oranges in California.
translated: Ils font pousser des oranges en Californie.

original: She wants to marry a millionaire.
translated: Elle veut épouser un millionnaire.

original: Why do you want to do that?
translated: Pourquoi voulez-vous faire cela ?

original: She is very kind to us.
translated: Elle est très gentille avec nous.

original: We wanted you.
translated: Nous vous voulions.

original: Let's eat while the food is warm.
translated: Mangeons pendant que c'est chaud.

original: Today's newspapers recounted a meeting of Esperantists.
translated: Les journaux du jour ont relaté une réunion d'espérantistes.

original: I remember giving him the key.
translated: Je me souviens de lui avoir donné la clé.

original: I can't do two things at a time.
translated: Je ne peux pas faire deux choses à la fois.

original: The subtitles are wrong.
translated: Les sous-titres sont faux.

original: I'm just nitpicking, of course.
translated: Je ne fais qu'ergoter, bien sûr.

original: I'd be willing to pay you.
translated: Je vous payerais volontiers.

original: I'd like to see a doctor.
translated: Je voudrais consulter un médecin.

original: Mary was wearing men's clothing.
translated: Mary portait des vêtements d'homme.

original: It is difficult to translate a poem correctly.
translated: Il est difficile de traduire un poème correctement.

original: How shall we deal with this problem?
translated: Comment allons-nous régler ce problème ?

original: Somebody is watching me.
translated: Quelqu'un est en train de me regarder.

original: Tom, it's not your fault.
translated: Tom, ce n'est pas de votre faute.

original: I tried to save you.
translated: J'ai essayé de vous sauver.

original: The rectangle and the rhombus are parallelograms.
translated: Le rectangle et le losange sont des parallélogrammes.

original: A swallow flies over the roof.
translated: Une hirondelle vole au dessus du toit.

original: I'm just kidding.
translated: Je rigole.

original: Get out of here and don't ever come back!
translated: Sors d'ici et ne reviens jamais !

original: Tom does that every Monday afternoon.
translated: Tom le fait tous les lundis après-midi.

original: As more time passed, these Creoles became separate languages: Spanish, French, Italian, etc.
translated: Au fil du temps, ces dialectes devinrent des langues à part entière : l'espagnol, le français, l'italien, etc.

original: What do you think is going to happen?
translated: Que pensez-vous qu'il arrive ?

original: Emili is pretty.
translated: Émilie est jolie.

original: She met somebody who many people meet.
translated: Elle a rencontré quelqu'un que beaucoup de monde rencontre.

original: Please don't write to me again.
translated: Je vous prie de ne plus m'écrire.

original: I hugged Emily.
translated: J'ai embrassé Émilie.

original: Do you want to do it?
translated: Veux-tu le faire ?

original: What are you going to have?
translated: Que prends-tu ?

original: You can't tell anyone about this.
translated: Vous ne pouvez en parler à quiconque.

original: I presented my ticket at the door.
translated: J'ai présenté mon billet à la porte.

original: There's no hurry.
translated: Il n'y a pas le feu au lac.

original: What goes on in here?
translated: Qu'est-ce qui se passe, là-dedans ?

original: You won't be harmed.
translated: On ne te fera pas de mal.

original: Be careful about what you eat.
translated: Sois prudent quant à ce que tu manges.

original: I ordered frogs and noodles.
translated: Je commandai des pâtes aux grenouilles.

original: In case of an emergency, push this button.
translated: En cas d'urgence, appuyez sur ce bouton.

original: I'm not convinced at all.
translated: Je ne suis pas du tout convaincue.

original: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
translated: Les fous se précipitent là où les anges craignent de mettre les pieds.

original: It is not matter that generates thought, but thought that generates matter.
translated: Ce n'est pas la matière qui engendre la pensée, mais la pensée qui engendre la matière.

original: You're talking just like your father.
translated: Tu parles comme ton père.

original: What is it you want most?
translated: Que veux-tu le plus ?

original: I know that Tom has gone to Boston.
translated: Je sais que Tom est allé à Boston.

original: I thought it was very easy.
translated: Je pensais que c’était du gâteau.

original: Here I have the map.
translated: J'ai ici la carte.

original: I'm accustomed to this.
translated: J'y suis habitué.

original: It was cheaper than I thought.
translated: Ce fut meilleur marché que je le pensais.

original: I am uncertain as to whether I am the right person for the job.
translated: Je ne suis pas certain d'être la bonne personne pour ce travail.

original: I would not have asked you if I was not interested.
translated: Je ne t'aurais pas demandé si ça ne m'intéressait pas.

original: She didn't feel that she was ready.
translated: Elle ne se sentait pas prête.

original: He is accustomed to working hard.
translated: Il a l'habitude de travailler dur.

original: Tom ate his sandwich quickly.
translated: Tom a rapidement mangé son sandwich.

original: They're friends.
translated: Ils sont amis.

original: He's out of town.
translated: Il ne se trouve pas en ville.

original: Tom approved.
translated: Tom a donné son accord.

original: I can't just not do anything.
translated: Je ne peux pas me contenter de ne rien faire.

original: I made them myself.
translated: Je les ai faits moi-même.

original: I feel so happy when I'm with you.
translated: Je me sens tellement heureux lorsque je suis avec toi.

original: I'd cut down those trees if I were you.
translated: J'abattrais ces arbres si j'étais vous.

original: Tom's a lumberjack.
translated: Tom est bûcheron.

original: Tom changed his diet.
translated: Tom changea son alimentation.

original: I want you out of here right now.
translated: Je veux que tu sortes d'ici immédiatement.

original: He is good at singing.
translated: Il chante bien.

original: It'll be difficult to glue the two pieces together.
translated: Il sera difficile de coller les deux morceaux ensemble.

original: They wake up at six every morning.
translated: Ils se lèvent à six heures tous les matins.

original: I'm not allowed to talk about that.
translated: Je ne suis pas autorisée à parler de ça.

original: Do you want me to talk to Tom about what's going to happen?
translated: Voulez-vous que je parle à Tom de ce qu'il va se passer ?

original: There are millions of stars in the universe.
translated: Il y a des millions d'étoiles dans l'univers.

original: Sorry, I didn't mean to snap at you.
translated: Désolée, je ne voulais pas vous mordre.

original: What do you want me to tell Tom?
translated: Que veux-tu que je dise à Tom ?

original: He didn't like being separated from his family.
translated: Il n'aimait être séparé de sa famille.

original: The turnips are ready to harvest.
translated: Les navets sont prêts à être récoltés.

original: The check, please.
translated: La note, s'il vous plait.

original: Did you study French yesterday?
translated: As-tu étudié le français hier ?

original: Did you see my cat?
translated: As-tu vu mon chat ?

original: As for me, I like chicken better than pork.
translated: En ce qui me concerne, je préfère le poulet au porc.

original: Riding double on a bicycle is dangerous.
translated: C'est dangereux d'être à deux sur un vélo.

original: What is it you want me to do?
translated: Que voulez-vous que je fasse ?

original: If only she'd wear summer clothes.
translated: Si seulement elle portait des vêtements d'été.

original: Why does it have to be me?
translated: Pourquoi c'est à moi de le faire ?

original: Are you sure they are not right?

original: There is a little money in the bag.
translated: Il y a un peu d'argent dans le sac.

original: I felt bad.
translated: Je me sentis mal.

original: I don't get very many opportunities to talk with native speakers.
translated: Je n'ai pas souvent l'occasion de parler avec des locuteurs natifs.

original: There is only one religion, though there are a hundred versions of it.
translated: Il n'y a qu'une religion, même s'il y a en a cent versions.

original: Tom sat down and waited.
translated: Tom s'assit et attendit.

original: Where are the candles? Give me a box of matches!
translated: Où sont les bougies ? Donne-moi une boite d'allumettes !

original: I'm leaving tonight.
translated: Je pars ce soir.

original: Can you teach me how to drive?
translated: Est-ce que tu peux m'apprendre à conduire ?

original: It wasn't very fun.
translated: Ce ne fut pas très marrant.

translated: Pythagore disait qu'il avait reçu en cadeau de Mercure la transmigration perpétuelle de son âme, de sorte qu'elle transmigrait et passait constamment dans toutes de sortes de plantes ou d'animaux.

original: He was hurt in a car accident.
translated: Il a été blessé dans un accident de voiture.

original: Among the audience, there were students, teachers, clerks, and so on.
translated: Parmi le public, il y avait des étudiants, des professeurs, des employés, etc.

original: She came to like the house.
translated: Elle a fini par aimer cette maison.

original: Alice rushed into her room.
translated: Alice se précipita dans sa chambre.

original: Do you really think I'm that gullible?
translated: Penses-tu vraiment que je suis aussi crédule ?

original: Her anger is understandable.
translated: Sa colère est compréhensible.

original: Opening the door, I found a stranger standing there.
translated: En ouvrant la porte, j'ai trouvé un inconnu qui se tenait là.

original: This is an another pair of shoes.
translated: C'est une autre paire de chaussures.

original: At this juncture, we're looking into every possibility.
translated: À ce stade, nous examinons toutes les possibilités.

original: I had all the money stolen and was in trouble.
translated: Je me suis fait voler tout l'argent, et j'ai eu des ennuis.

original: I have something I want to tell you.
translated: J'ai quelque chose que je veux te dire.

original: I have an account at that book shop.
translated: J'ai un compte ouvert dans cette librairie.

original: She takes a shower every morning.
translated: Elle prend une douche chaque matin.

original: You should have told him.
translated: Vous auriez dû lui dire.

original: We left our husbands.
translated: Nous avons quitté nos époux.

original: He became furious.
translated: Il est devenu furieux.

original: Why do you have to be like that?

original: Does that suit you?

original: I just don't want to get your hopes up.
translated: Je ne veux pas vous faire former de faux espoirs, un point c'est tout.

original: I haven't been invited yet.
translated: Je ne suis pas encore invité.

original: I haven't got much money.
translated: Je n'ai pas beaucoup d'argent.

original: They thought they should do that.
translated: Ils pensaient devoir le faire.

original: You must stick to your promise.
translated: Tu dois tenir ta promesse.

original: We were there.
translated: Nous étions là.

original: I made you coffee.
translated: Je vous ai fait du café.

original: Would you like another piece of cake?
translated: Tu veux encore un truc facile ?

original: I watered one.
translated: J'en ai arrosé une.

original: You're obviously too drunk to drive.
translated: Tu es, à l'évidence, trop ivre pour conduire.

original: I fell from a height.
translated: Je suis tombée d’une hauteur.

original: We didn't know which bus we would take.
translated: Nous ne savions pas quel bus prendre.

original: You didn't do a very good job, I said.
translated: "Vous n'avez pas fait du très bon travail", dis-je.

original: I don't think it was an accident.
translated: Je ne crois pas que cela ait été un accident.

original: Do come in, please.
translated: Entrez, s'il vous plaît.

original: Dress warmly, the night air is very cold.
translated: Mets des vêtements chauds, l'air du soir est très froid.

original: Who knows!
translated: Qui sait ?

original: This bread is too expensive.
translated: Ce pain coûte trop cher.

original: Scandalous!
translated: Scandaleux !

original: How come I've never seen you here before?
translated: Comment se fait-il que je ne t'ai jamais vue ici auparavant ?

original: The cost of living is very high in Tokyo.
translated: Le coût de la vie est très élevé à Tokyo.

original: The most incredible thing about miracles is that they happen.
translated: La chose la plus incroyable avec les miracles, c'est qu'ils arrivent.

original: English is studied all over the world.
translated: L'anglais est étudié partout dans le monde.

original: They found Tom in the crowd.
translated: Ils ont trouvé Tom dans la foule.

original: One vice leads to another.
translated: Un vice conduit à un autre.

original: I want to take you to lunch.
translated: Je veux vous emmener déjeuner.

original: My first attempt at making wheat bread with my bread machine was a success.
translated: La première fois que j’ai essayé de faire un pain de blé avec mon robot boulanger à été un succès.

original: Are you crying?
translated: Pleures-tu ?

original: I lost a shoe. I'm sure that someone hid it.
translated: J'ai perdu une chaussure ; je suis sûr qu'on l'a cachée.

original: Why did they do that?
translated: Pourquoi elles ont fait ça ?

original: Three kings and two eights earned him a full house.
translated: Trois rois et deux huit lui donnèrent une main pleine.

original: I take it for granted that you will join.
translated: Je prends pour acquis que tu te joindras à nous.

original: I hope you have a good time!
translated: J'espère que vous passez du bon temps !

original: Oh, shoot! I forgot to call Uncle Tom.
translated: Oh, zut ! J'ai oublié d'appeler oncle Tom.

original: How much money did you spend on your last holiday?
translated: Combien d'argent as-tu claqué pour tes dernières vacances ?

original: I drank the milk that was left over from breakfast.
translated: J'ai bu le lait qui restait du petit déjeuner.

original: The streets were quiet.
translated: Les rues étaient calmes.

original: I have to be very careful.
translated: Je dois faire très attention.

original: The bank does not open on Saturdays.
translated: La banque n'est pas ouverte le samedi.

original: We're now in February.
translated: Nous sommes en février.

original: That is a nice shirt.
translated: C'est une belle chemise.

original: It's wonderful.
translated: C'est merveilleux !

original: You're talking for the sake of it.
translated: Tu parles pour ne rien dire.

original: They are all very busy.
translated: Ils sont tous très occupés.

original: He's not fooled.
translated: Il n’est pas dupe.

original: Tom's French pronunciation isn't as good as he thinks it is.
translated: La prononciation du français de Tom n'est pas aussi bonne qu'il ne le pense.

original: Yes. Everyone admires the pictures painted by him.
translated: Oui, tout le monde admire les tableaux qu'il peint.

original: The leaves of the tree turned yellow.
translated: Les feuilles de l'arbre ont jauni.

original: She advised him to talk about his life in America.
translated: Elle lui conseilla de parler de sa vie en Amérique.

original: His father administers some companies.
translated: Son père dirige quelques sociétés.

original: You'll see the difference.
translated: Vous verrez la différence.

original: No one will speak for you.
translated: Personne ne parlera à ta place.

original: If you need my advice, I'd be glad to give it to you.
translated: Si vous aviez besoin de mes conseils, je serais ravi de vous les apporter.

original: I never use this anymore.
translated: Je n'emploie jamais plus ceci.

original: I read a couple of more chapters before I went to sleep.
translated: J'ai lu quelques chapitres supplémentaires avant d'aller dormir.

original: You agree with him.
translated: Vous êtes d'accord avec lui.

original: I'd like to know why Tom doesn't like me.
translated: J'aimerais savoir pourquoi Tom ne m'aime pas.

original: I have only myself to blame, I suppose.
translated: Je ne peux m'en prendre qu'à moi-même, je suppose.

original: You've earned a rest.
translated: Vous avez mérité une pause.
